problem.p: A brick of mass m slides down a frictionless slope of height h. You may treat the brick as a point object. At the bottom of the slope is a flat patch with friction.
The goal is to determine the eventual speed of the brick after it has moved along the flat area for a given time \(t\). Consider the following approach for determining the speed.

ol.li: Use conservation of energy to determine the kinetic energy of the brick at the bottom of the slope.
Use the mass of the brick to determine the normal force.
Calculate the frictional force on the brick.
Use the work-energy theorem to determine the change in kinetic energy over a particular distance, and thus the brickâ€™s new kinetic energy.
Use the new kinetic energy to determine the speed of the brick.

problem.p: That solution has an error. At what step does this error appear? (Enter a number from 1 to 5).
